title: Even as he threatens Israel, Nasrallah gestures at future border talks
description: After a week of spiking tensions, the Hezbollah leader signaled de-escalation, hinting that Lebanon could be open to border talks with Israel after a Gaza ceasefire.

title: On Lebanese border, Israelis fear a new kind of war with Hezbollah
description: 70,000 Israelis evacuated their homes in the north in the wake of Oct. 7, turning the area into a closed military zone. They fear Hezbollah and don’t trust their leaders.

title: Christmas is over, and these elephants are feasting on leftover trees
description: Elephants at Berlin’s Tierpark Zoo enjoy munching on unsold Christmas trees, in what has become an annual event.

title: Israel-Gaza war live updates: Blinken heads to Middle East amid fears of war’s spread
description: The trip comes after a U.S. strike that killed an Iran-linked militia commander in Iraq and the suspected Israeli killing of a Hamas leader in Lebanon.

title: Oscar Pistorius released on parole 11 years after murdering girlfriend
description: Pistorius was convicted of murdering his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp. The Paralympian was entitled to be considered for parole once he served half his total sentence,

title: North Korea fires shells toward South, sending islanders to bomb shelters
description: North Korea fired 200 shells near two South Korean islands in the Yellow Sea including Yeonpyeong Island, the scene of a deadly 2010 North Korean attack.

title: Israeli calls for Gaza’s ethnic cleansing are only getting louder
description: The human misery unfurling across Gaza finds little sympathy in the Israeli public discourse, where the priority remains the vanquishing of Hamas.

title: Pepsi, Lay’s dropped by one of the world’s biggest grocers over price hikes
description: France-based Carrefour, one of the world’s largest grocery chains, told customers Thursday it is pulling Lay’s, Doritos, Lipton teas and other PepsiCo products in protest of increased prices.
